intro: Telanthera galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos telanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the islands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
